definition: rice tub (from which cooked rice or other food is served)/(fig.) fathead/a good-for-nothing
bucket/(trash) can/barrel (of oil etc)/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Grilled Sculpin now correctly grants Ranged Attack Power.
sentences.chinese: 烤肉饭桶现在正确的赠款远程攻击力。

sentences.english: Poor clever boy besides it is a big big eater, still be a big Lothario .
sentences.chinese: 瘦猴除了是个大饭桶，还是个大色狼。

sentences.english: In fact, he is good for nothing.
Everyone from frash to presidents loves these words.
sentences.chinese: 从饭桶到总统，所有人都喜欢这几个词。

sentences.english: I don't know why you are still knocking about with him who is good-for-nothing.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道你为什么还与他混在一起，他简直是个饭桶。

sentences.english: Luo Cai check for nothing nearly found drawings, fortunately Fang Gui timely help.
sentences.chinese: 罗财检查饭桶时险些发现设计图，幸好方贵及时帮忙。

sentences.english: Everyone from trash to presidents loves these words.
sentences.chinese: 从饭桶到总统，所有的人都喜欢用这几个单词。

definition: wine sack, food bag (idiom); useless person, only fit for guzzling and boozing
to eat plain rice/(fig.) to eat and not pay for it/to sponge off others/to freeload
unable to accomplish anything but liable to spoil everything (idiom)/unable to do anything right/never make, but always mar
pinyin: cheng2 shi4 bu4 zu2 , bai4 shi4 you3 yu2
